name: Blink
body:
# Welcome to the Blink's GitHub page!

Here you will find more details on Blink, its source code and a step-by-step guide to recreate a Blink's virtual machine from scratch.

## Blink in a nutshell

Browser fingerprinting allows websites and third-party companies to track users silently. The combination of uniqueness and stability of browser fingerprints make them ripe targets for exploitation. Furthermore, fingerprinting is complementary to other tracking techniques such as cookies. We introduce Blink, a moving target defense strategy against fingerprint-based user tracking. Each time a browsing session starts, Blink leverages virtualization and modular software architectures to automatically synthesize parts of a user’s platform that are the most distinguishable in a fingerprint, and modify them over time. We operate on the operating system, the browser, the lists of fonts and plugins. Blink automatically transfers user preferences (i.e., passwords, open tabs, bookmarks, selected plugins and fonts) from one environment to another to improve transparency and usability. This way, a user exhibits very diverse fingerprints over time without the risk of lying, but also keeps personal elements for a good browsing experience.

You will find below a concept overview of Blink.

![](https://github.com/breaklinkability/blink/raw/gh-pages/images/overview.png)

##Database for synthesizing browsing environments
###List of plugins 
* LibreOffice Plug-in
* QuickTime Plug-in 7.6.6
* Java(TM) Plug-in 11.5.2
* Java(TM) Plug-in 10.55.2
* Java(TM) Plug-in 1.6.0_45
* IcedTea-Web Plugin
* Estonian ID card plugin
* NPAPI Plugins Wrapper 1.4.4
* iTunes Application Detector
* Gnome Shell Integration
* FreeWRL X3D/VRML
* Spice Firefox Plugin 2.8.90
* MozPlugger 1.14.3
* Shockwave Flash 12.1 r720 (libkpartsplugin.so)
* Shockwave Flash 11.1 r102 (libtotem-vegas-plugin.so)
* Shockwave Flash 11.2 r202 (libflashplayer.so)
* Shockwave Flash 10.1 r999 (libgnashplugin.so)
* KParts Plugin
* gxine starter plugin
* DjView-4.9
* X2GoClient Plug-in 4.0.2.0
* Google Talk Plugin Video Renderer
* Xine Plugin
* Google Talk Plugin
* VLC Web Plugin
* Skype Buttons for Kopete
* PackageKit
* Windows Media Player Plug-in
* mplayerplug-in is now gecko-mediaplayer 1.0.9
* RealPlayer 9
* DivX Browser Plug-In
* DivX® Web Player
* VLC Multimedia Plugin
* Windows Media Player Plug-in 10
* QuickTime Plug-in 7.6.9

###List of browsers
* Firefox 28.0 (stable)
* Firefox 29.0 (beta)
* Firefox 30.0 (aurora)
* Chrome 34 (stable)
* Chrome 35 (beta)
* Chrome 36 (unstable)

###List of OS
* Fedora 20 32 bits
* Fedora 20 64 bits
* Ubuntu 14.04 32 bits
* Ubuntu 14.04 64 bits

###List of fonts
See database for the complete list of files.

## Implementation

### Source code
Clone, fork or download our source code in the Blink's repository [HERE](https://github.com/breaklinkability/blink).

### Step-by-step virtual machine creation
Follow [this link](https://github.com/breaklinkability/blink/wiki) to get the entire story behind the creation of a Blink virtual machine.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
